body_html:
Huh, seems that it's a dynamic loader issue. Some people had the same problem with TensorFlow (see tensorflow/tensorflow#6744). It's probably some shared memory issue like too many open references or shm files. I don't think we can debug that without a good repro, and unfortunately you seem to be the only one suffering from that 😕

Can you try removing all torch-related packages, reinstalling them, and rebooting your system? Also, do you have cuDNN installed somewhere? We're including it in our binaries, but maybe you have it in some cuda dirs.

body:
Huh, seems that it's a dynamic loader issue. Some people had the same problem with TensorFlow (see tensorflow/tensorflow#6744). It's probably some shared memory issue like too many open references or shm files. I don't think we can debug that without a good repro, and unfortunately you seem to be the only one suffering from that 😕

Can you try removing all torch-related packages, reinstalling them, and rebooting your system? Also, do you have cuDNN installed somewhere? We're including it in our binaries, but maybe you have it in some cuda dirs.
